page.title: 09HOUSING 2
page.content:
The Northwest area is mainly residential, built in the 1920s and '30s, with some recent (1973) developments. It is predominately middle class. Main features are the{Greenfields {Hospital} and the{New River Stadium}.
The{Stadium}was built about 10 years ago and cost about Â£6,000,000. 25 people work there and it costs Â£250,000 per year to run, but only takes in Â£100,000 from those who use it! It is run by the local council and caters for children, women, schools and special courses (e.g.fitness training), as well as casual use.
